boardgame.name: Гравити Фолс: Спасти Пухлю
boardgame.description:
Alert! Waddles has disappeared! It's hard to imagine what this piggy will have to face out there! Pterodactyls! Sea monsters! Bill Cipher's plotting and scheming! Hurry! The one who finds Waddles and brings him back to the Mystery Shack will earn eternal glory and fifteen-poundy love of the cutest pig in the world!

Contents:

7 Path cards
3 Mystery Shack cards
5 Character cards
1 Waddles card
5 Character standees
1 Waddles standee
21 Aid cards
21 Hindrance cards
1 die

Game rules



=====Russian description====

Гравити Фолз: Спасти Пухлю

Катастрофа! Пухля пропал! Страшно подумать, какие опасности грозят беззащитному поросёночку в дикой природе. Птеродактили! Морские чудовища! Козни Билла Шифра! Скорее на поиски! Тот, кто найдёт Пухлю и вернёт его в Хижину Чудес, удостоится вечной славы и необъятной любви лучшего в мире поросёнка.

boardgame.name: Sandstone
boardgame.description:
Sandstone is an almost abstract, area control game for two players. This is the first title in Small Box Games' Small Batch line of games.

Played over 5 Years (or rounds), players gain points at the end of the game for their played pieces and controlled spaces. However, a player may win the game before the end of the 5th year by meeting one of the winning conditions: controlling seven spaces of a single type, placing all 3 of their Outposts, or having 4 more placed Towers than the other player.

12 double sided cards, each with two spaces, are randomly arranged in a 3x4 grid at the beginning of the game. Each player controls 8 Towers and 3 Strongholds. Players control the spaces their Towers occupy, as well as the unoccupied spaces that are orthogonally adjacent to their Strongholds.

Controlled Desert spaces determine priority. Forest spaces grant them strength and the ability to remove or replace opposing Towers. Mountains grant gold, which players spend to keep their pieces in play at the end of the Year.

Each Year, each player receives 2 actions, chosen from 3 different options: Tower Action, Stronghold Action, or Ability Action, with each of these options offering 2 choices.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Animalesque!
boardgame.description:
Animalesque! is a game on body image, dance and burlesque, in which players will have to "fight" each other in a dance challenge between characters, exploiting moves offered by unique body types.
During the dance-off, each player draws a specific "theme" to fit, which drives the choice of colored dice to pick for placement and scoring. Players can choose among different characters, each representing an animal with a specific body type. Each character can use different "moves" during her turn to increase the chance of success. Every turn is won by the highest-scoring player, up to the tenth and final turn.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Wazabi: Supplément Piment
boardgame.description:
Wazabi: Supplément Piment, an expansion that can be used with all editions of Wazabi, includes eight dice and twenty cards with new effects to spice up gameplay and that require you to pay close attention during the turns of other players.

The additional components make it possible to have up to eight players in the game.

boardgame.name: Kurrüf
boardgame.description:
Kurruf: Aventura en la Selva Patagonica: is a simple and dynamic family game portraying the biodiversity of the Park Huilo-Huilo.

We roll dice, walk the marked trails on the game board, activate lockers, obtain biodiversity cards, use Mapuche tips, and score points for completing biodiversity scales.

In Kurruf, players are racing to be the first to get to 50 points on the point track. They’ll win points by acquiring and combining different cards depicting organisms (Biodiversity Cards), either through building food chains according to their relationships within the different ecosystems or by possessing majorities on the different kinds of cards acquired.

The player board is divided into four quadrants, each one depicting an ecosystem. These quadrants are traversed by tracks with different symbols on them.

On their turn, each player will roll a die and move their Explorer into the track across one of the four ecosystems, advancing as many spaces as indicated by the roll. If later on any other player lands on the same space, they will share it.

Upon landing on a space, the player will immediately take a card depending on the symbol depicted on that space.

All Biodiversity Cards acquired are laid face up on the table, building rows. As soon as a row has been built up as a complete food chain, it must be scored. All the cards which were used to build it are then discarded into a discard pile.

After all actions for that player have been resolved, gameplay goes around the table in clockwise order and the first player to get to 50 points is the winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: トワイライトラヴィーン (Twilight Ravine)
boardgame.description:
The third piece of the Kradia world series "Twilight Ravine".

Like the previous game "Kradia II: Wild Hunting Festival", it is a stand-alone game, independent from "Kradia I: The Garden of Adventurers".

Kradia: Twilight Ravine (トワイライトラヴィーン) is a simple and quick party game. The game requires players to collect different cards on the field. And by hindering opponents from getting the maximum points, it will feel a bit similar to mahjong.

Compared to the gaming nature of the previous two games, the new game experience is a 180-degree shift. But similar to the game's predecessors, Twilight Ravine revolves around a group of adventurers seeking treasures. Overall, the setting is designed to complement and expand the world view of the Kradia.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: ワイルドハントフェス (Wild Hunt Festival)
ワイルドハントフェス (Wild Hunt Festival)

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical Digital
boardgame.description: The Lock ’n Load Tactical series is a dynamic squad-level tactical combat computer game based on the award-winning board games of the same name. LnLT series centered on infantry combat from the 1930s to the present.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Modern Era Computer Wargame Nominee

boardgame.name: Nations At War Digital
boardgame.description: Nations At War series is a dynamic platoon-level combat computer game based on the award-winning board games of the same series name. Nations At War series centered on armor, artillery and infantry combat during World War 2.

boardgame.name: Astronots: Betrayal Awaits
boardgame.description:
Astronots – Betrayal Awaits is a social deduction party game where you are sent on a space mission to discover a new habitable planet for humankind when you realize something odd: You've been hijacked by alien parasites.

Players are divided into two distinct teams and are racing each other to victory. The game takes place in a series of rounds where players will pick and play cards from other player's hands in order to achieve their team's goal. The Crew musts play two Serum cards in order to neutralize the extraterrestrial threat, whilst the Parasites must play five Contagion cards to win the game.

In Astronots – Betrayal Awaits, it is forbidden to play your own cards. Players pick and play cards from others' hands. You will need to decipher who's friend or foe, all the while convincing the other players that you have the cards that will lead their team to victory. Other than the Serums and Contagions, these cards will let you learn information about other players, counter certain strategies, and change how the game itself is played.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Pet Cemetery
boardgame.description:
The Pet Cemetery is an exciting pet monster-themed tabletop board game for 2 to 6 players that is easy to learn, family-friendly, and is great for parties and game nights! Players use strategy, planning, and educated guesses to outwit their opponents and be the first to capture the Professor.

Game Play:

Players start at the edge of the cemetery with 3 cards in hand. On their turn they can move one space toward the end, play a card, or draw a card from the deck.

The game board tiles and game cards include a variety of actions that allow players to spawn and move pet monsters into the path of their opponents, search for treasure, keep themselves safe from attacks, jump over obstacles, skip opponents turns, and cheat as they navigate their way across the board and attempt to hinder the progress of their opponents.

Cards can be chained together to create amazing combos that allow players to maximize each turn. The first player to find a set of handcuff cards in the deck and cross the finish line wins the game.

Additionally, each player is randomly dealt one of the 10 unique character cards. Each character has a unique ability that players can use during the game to give them a unique advantage over the others, so pay close attention to what each player can do so you can plan ahead!

Do you have what it takes to win The Pet Cemetery?

-description from designer

listing.notes: Contents: Brand New in Shrink. Box: Brand New in Shrink. No damage noted.

boardgame.name: Tranquil Terror
boardgame.description:
Tranquil Terror is a tile- sliding game where each diver must recover sunken treasure without being stung by the ever-shifting jellyfish. Players must make strategic decisions every turn as they try to find advantage using a limited action economy.

Every turn repositions the tiles, and every action has ripple effects. Each player has a limited air supply that they must protect while maneuvering around the board. Players have the choice each turn for what actions to take. Actions include searching for treasure, shooing away a single Jellyfish, moving, expending air to shift an entire row of jellies, or recovering treasure. When players manage to recover a treasure in the game, they collect a physical treasure gem to add to their hoard.

The key event comes every turn as an increasing number of tiles are added to one side of the play area, and slid across. The sliding tiles push the furthest tiles off the game play surface, thus rearranging the board. The tiles are chose at random, but placed carefully. If a jelly stings a diver, they lose air. As they lose air, the number of tiles being added each turn increases.

In order to win, divers must recover 10 treasures first. However there is not always a winner. All players must search for treasure while keeping an eye on their air tank. If the air tank gauge reaches empty, their search is over.

boardgame.name: Vectrexians
boardgame.description:
No need to introduce this classic anymore, shoot Your way through the attacking alien convoys...
There are some improvements done on the preliminary version, which was posted for a long time on my site : corrected bugs, implemented an intro-screen and improved sound-effects more to the original.

Main differences of new vectrexians:
- Calibration menu to compensate drift.
- Players-ship is drawn more stable.
- "difficulty" menu (1=easy, 2 = normal, 3 = hard)
- Introduction intermission ("we are the vectrexians")
- Enemies move faster in the convoy.
- Enhanced sound more to the original, including the background noise that irritated a lot of people :-)
- A 3D rendered animation In the beginning of the game
- A 3D rendered animation during the end-game (after beating level 20)
- End credits
- A pause-button (button 3)

boardgame.name: Kingswood: Kickstarter Promos
boardgame.description:
Promo items during the Kickstarter campaign:
1) Kings's Favor Starting Player Coin
2) Dock Location
3) Panzoo Tapestry (Druid) character guild card and scoring banner token
4) Card with instructions for the Dock Location

Note: For backers of the regular edition, the promos come packaged in a separate bag and shipped with the game.
These items are included inside the Royal Edition box.

boardgame.name: Alhambra: Exclusive Queenie 2020
Alhambra: New Market
boardgame.description:
Note: If purchased separately though, it will not include the Dice needed for the market, just the main board and the buildings in both a normal and large size.

Playing with the New Market board in the base game of Alhambra requires the 12 dice from the Roll & Write

At the beginning of the game, the New Market is set up alongside the original market and filled with the 6 buildings. Then, one yellow and one blue dice are rolled and placed next to each building.

On their turn, players may take a new action of buying from the new market. To take the building from the market, they must have the exact currency cards in yellow and blue to match one space. If they do, they show the cards, take the building, but keep the currency cards in their hand. The market is not refilled—once all 6 buildings are gone, this action is no longer available.

To accommodate every backer, the building tiles come in 2 sizes to be played either with the Alhambra revised edition or the Mega Box edition which has larger tiles.

Components:
1 New Market Tableau
6 building tiles

boardgame.name: Capes & Cowls
boardgame.description:
Capes & Cowls is a rules-light tabletop roleplaying game about SuperHeroes. One player is the Narrator who controls The City, its Citizens and the Villains within. The other players take on the role of Super Heroes of their own design, sworn to protect and defend The City. The game can be set up in a few minutes and played as a one-shot for an evening of fun, or as an ongoing campaign where the heroes work and grow together to thwart Villain after Villain.

All you need to play are the rulebook, some 6-sided dice (D6), pencils & paper, a couple of friends and about an hour. We think you might like this game if:


You're looking for a tabletop RPG to play with your kids (or one they can play by themselves). We've tested this game with players as young as 5.



You're interested in trying a tabletop RPG but are intimidated by other systems with lots of rules.



You're an experienced RPG player looking for a "change-of-pace" game that's simple and light-hearted.


- from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Millennial Manatees
boardgame.description:
A casual strategy game showing the adventurous entrepreneurial spirit of millennials... packaged inside a wearable "Fanatee Pack"
Players Bid for new Venture cards to earn coins in an attempt to be the first to pay back student loans first.
Job levels have different difficulty levels (Basic, Salty, or Big Mood) and perks if the correct manatee Customer is drawn. And if none of those jobs appeal to you you can always take a volunteer position of get a boomer handout.
First to pay back 20 manatee coins in student loans wins!

boardgame.name: Cloud City
Felhőváros
Miasto w chmurach
클라우드 시티
boardgame.description:
In Cloud City, you compete against other architects to create the best city planning project to be chosen by the city council. Have your project chosen and built for the people of Cloud City to enjoy!

Develop your city with buildings and build walkways to connect buildings to one another. Walkways earn city council votes and the longer the walkway, the more points. Walkways can earn 1, 2, 3, 5, or 8 city council votes. River walkways connect the smallest buildings, forest walkways connect midsize buildings, and ice walkways connect the tallest buildings. The architect with the city plan that features the most and the longest walkways will win the game!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 5 Seasons Best International Family Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 51: Tang Garden, Coatl, Shaolia, Cloud City - Top 5 Relaxing Games

boardgame.name: Drinking Quest: Old Habits
boardgame.description:
A great stand-alone game or the followup to DQ: Liquor Before Honor
A throwback to the golden age of 80’s RPGs!

Quest 1: Slime Time

In this quest the heroes will fight oozing monsters, find sticky treasure chests, avoid slimy salesmen and maybe have a slippery sexual encounter or two.

Quest 2: OktoberQuest

This quest pokes fun at heritage beer festivals.

Quest 3: Whiskey & Wights

You’ll fight the alcoholic undead! You’ll loot corpses, fight a wrecked reaper, drink a 10,000 year old Scotch and even stop to make bacon in your underwear!

Quest 4; Crafbor’s Keep

This quests see the adventuring party visit a CRAFT CIDER BREWERY run by a sadistic tyrant who really loves cider.

Bonus Quest: High Fantasy

After years of players asking Jason to make a “Weed Quest
the best that’s going to happen is this quest where the heroes walk through an Alice in Wonderland type forest with hallucinogenic effects.

Bonus Quest: Sober Up PSAs

This quest features 12 ways to sober up in Public Service Announcement style. Add this quest onto the end of the game if you want to drink some water.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

boardgame.name: Kingswood: Royal Edition
boardgame.description: Deluxe edition of Kingswood. This version contains everything in the regular edition of Kingswood and the Kingswood: Kickstarter Promos, which features a King's Favor coin, bonus location (Docks), and bonus character guild (Panzoo Tapestry). The component upgrades include wooden resource tokens (swords, hearts, spell books)and metal coin set.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Kingswood Royal Edition

listing.notes:

+Shipping Local pickup available from 92886
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

This is the KS deluxe edition, with all the Stretch Goals, upgraded Wooden Resources, and Metal Coins. This order will also include all of the following: [thing=313959][/thing], [thing=299210][/thing], and the [thing=317116][/thing].

boardgame.name: The Book of Unlife
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

The are neither alive nor dead. They inhabit the world in between. But all too often the living are their prey.

This book includes 44 creatures for The Fantasy Trip, a guide to the general powers and vulnerabilities of the unliving, and a complete adventure setting, The Haunting of Holner House.

boardgame.name: Red Crypt
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A Solo Adventure For One Brave Hero

It started out as a simple bounty hunt. But your quarry has fled to a place that belongs to the dead. If you’re lucky, they might be your friends against foes that mock both life and death. Dare you enter the RED CRYPT?

boardgame.name: Stonehenge
boardgame.description:
The Stonehenge game is a working model of the real monolith.

The site cards indicate locations of henges from the Orkney Islands to the south of England, and includes Ireland, Scotland, and Wales.

Like the late Neolithic original, the Stonehenge game is a computer for the Sun - Earth - Moon orbits required to predict the eclipses of the Sun and Moon.

The game incorporates the phases of the Moon, the Solstices, and both Equinoxes.

—description from the publisher

Game participation will reinforce knowledge of astronomy, math, geography, and history.

boardgame.name: Lovelace & Babbage: Scott Aldie Card
boardgame.description:
Given out at BGG Con 2019.

This is a patron card that demands a 23 and gets you a purple or a green influence.

Note: This has been confirmed by the publisher as an alternate artwork card.

boardgame.name: 50 Sea Dogs 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shiver me timbers! This list provides 50 detailed pirates and other scurvy ridden sea dogs to infest your ships and saucy portside taverns with. Included in each entry is the following: First name and surname, gender (most are males but there are a few lasses), a general descriptive element about the character, weapon(s) carried and used, coins on their person, and a special treasure/carried item.

Random roll the percentile dice to use just one or a few, or fill up that cursed old galleon with the whole wretched lot of these scoundrels!

This list is suitable for historical era and fantasy settings alike.

boardgame.name: All Us Gamers : The Book of Struggles
boardgame.description:
The Book of Struggles is an extension to the All Us Gamers Inner Core Rules. It is optional, but recommended, to also use the On Aptitude extension.

Your character is in a conflict, a combat has broken out, you need to sneak past vigilant guards, you are attempting to change the King's mind, or your starship has to make it to the asteroid first in a race for control.

You can use the inner core to simply handle these as a set of discrete actions by your character, your fellow player characters and their opponents. However it is a richer experience to pit the actions of your side and your opponents side together. Then you have advances, and set backs, advantage gained and lost and complications arising from the struggle.

The mechanism is easy, based on struggle moments and the struggle matrix.

Once you have used this you won't want to go back to the old way of doing things.

(DriveThruRPG.com description https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/319759/All-Us-Gamers--T...)
boardgame.rpg: All Us Gamers Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: 100 High School Kids 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different kids you would find in a high school setting. Included is first and last name, gender, class (Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior), and a clique/interest/group that the kid associates with (or is lumped into). Perfect for a variety of modern settings– from light hearted to teen drama to crime, also good for low level supers (particularly teen supers), teenage horror heroes/vampire killers. Also usable for early post apocalypse settings, zombie outbreaks, and/or some cyberpunk/dystopia use. Basically if you need teens and it would be good to know what clique they fit into (or didn’t) here is the list for you...

Also usable for early post apocalypse settings, zombie outbreaks, and/or some cyberpunk/dystopia use. Basically if you need teens and it would be good to know what clique they fit into (or didn’t) here is the list for you...

boardgame.name: 100 High School Kids 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different kids you would find in a high school setting. Included is first and last name, gender, class (Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior), and a clique/interest/group that the kid associates with (or is lumped into). Perfect for a variety of modern settings– from light hearted to teen drama to crime, also good for low level supers (particularly teen supers), teenage horror heroes/vampire killers. Also usable for early post apocalypse settings, zombie outbreaks, and/or some cyberpunk/dystopia use. Basically if you need teens and it would be good to know what clique they fit into (or didn’t) here is the list for you...

boardgame.name: 100 Dreamer's Visions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of 100 detailed visions that a fantasy genre character would have in their dreams. What better way for a Game Master to set up clues (and also glean potential adventure hooks) than presenting images of things to come to player characters as they are sleeping. Some of the provided visions are too the point while others much more surreal and subject to interpretation. If anything a few of these bizarre dreams (or nightmares) might get that wayward party headed off to see the local fortune teller… who we all know is the only person in the village who really knows what is going on!

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 03
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Professionals Set 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 50 Hobgoblin Encounters 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Way more Than Just Sword Fodder! Tired of simply saying “you’ve encountered 5 hobgoblins”? Want to bring some details into those vicious hobgoblin encounters? Here’s the list for you! This 1 page chart features 50 goblins with details suitable for most any tabletop fantasy role playing game. Included is a singular (first) name, the gender of the hobgoblin, a general descriptive, what they are wearing
(clothing or armor), what they are using as a weapon, what coins (if any) they are carrying, and 1 or 2 interesting things (sometimes valuable) that the hobgoblin has on their possession.

boardgame.name: 100 Seedy Starport Encounters 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wandering through the streets, crowded hallways, and cramped businesses of dirty, seedy starports are an endless variety of encounters. Some are travelers from distant worlds while others are natives. This list provides a name for each encounter as well as a role and brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: Goblin Kin Brigand Clan: Night Butchers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A whole pile of adventuring resources packed on a mere three pages (1 page is cover)!

The Night Butchers is a goblin kin brigand clan that is ready to drop into most any traditional old school/high fantasy role playing campaign. Though system/game edition generic, this product offers plenty of details to help the Game Master (GM) quickly flesh out all the other “need to know” stuff.

This product offers a brief background, list of brigand members, illustrated group symbol, briefly detailed cave lair, and information on the group treasure that is found in the lair. There is also a list of captured prisoners and a couple of adventure hooks.
